item.title: Java Configuration: JNDI and Naming Operations
item.description: Table Of Contents Background and Rationale What’s In A (Naming Service) Name? The Object Management Group Naming Service Specification JNDI Bootstrapping Retrieval Operations Binding Operations Name-to-Object Bindings Synthesizing Operations Putting It All Together Background and Rationale I’ve written previously about how Java configuration systems boiled down to their essence are simply systems for loading Java objects that are described in a particular way, usually by some kind of name (along with qualifiers), and that such systems have absolutely nothing to do with dependency injection.
